page.title: 12GROBY POST OFFICE.
page.content: My mum and dad own and run Groby Post Office.The people who come in range from small children to old age pesioners.Generally children come in for stamps and the older folk come for their pensions,to post letters and to pay bills.Money of some sort is paid out every day and includes family allowance,disabled pension,sick pay and unemployment benefit.People can pay bills like gas,electricity and water rates.As well as postage stamps there are others for T.V.licences, telephone bills and car tax which all make it easier for people to pay.The Post Office also offers the Girobank service.The local firms come in with parcels,letters and registered post. There are six postmen/women but a van delivers the parcels.After the Post Office closes my dad does the books and my mum does the pension tickets.
